alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 19 at 3:35AM HST until April 19 at 5:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM HST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... At 335 AM HST, Law Enforcement reported Highway 11 remains closed in the vicinity of Kawa Flats between mile marker 57 (Ninoole Loop) and mile marker 63 (Naalehu) due to water over the road. Rain intensity has decreased and is now falling at a rate of less than 0.5 inches per hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Wood Valley, Pahala, Punaluu Beach, Volcano, Kawa Flats, Naalehu, Fern Forest, Waiohinu, Discovery Harbour, Hawaii Volcanoes Park Kahuku Unit and Kalapana. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
